properties.Name: GatkCommandLine
properties.Description:
The GATK Command Line, or GATKCommandLine as it is often referenced, lines contain all the parameters that went used by the tool that generated the file.

 GATKCommandLine.HaplotypeCaller refers to a command line invoking HaplotypeCaller.

 These parameters include all the arguments that the tool accepts, along with the values that were applied (if you don't pass one, a default is applied); so it's not just the arguments specified explicitly by the user in the command line.

Columns.Name: ReferenceFile
Columns.Description:
The version of the VCF specification to which the file conforms.

In the flat file received this line will begin with ##reference.

Columns.Name: GeneSequencingFileFormatId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a gene sequencing file format.

Columns.Name: CommandLineId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Command Line.

Columns.Name: CommandLineOptions
Columns.Description: The options selected on the command line.

Columns.Name: Timestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the command line was run.

Columns.Name: Epoch
Columns.Description: A period of time associated with the running of the command line.

The GATK Command Line, or GATKCommandLine as it is often referenced, lines contain all the parameters that went used by the tool that generated the file.

 GATKCommandLine.HaplotypeCaller refers to a command line invoking HaplotypeCaller.

 These parameters include all the arguments that the tool accepts, along with the values that were applied (if you don't pass one, a default is applied); so it's not just the arguments specified explicitly by the user in the command line.
